translations.english_saheeh: Recite in the name of your Lord who created
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Read! In the Name of your Lord Who has created (all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: Read in the name of your Lord Who created,

translations.english_saheeh: Created man from a clinging substance.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood).
translations.english_rwwad: created man from a clinging clot.

translations.english_saheeh: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous.
translations.english_rwwad: Read, and your Lord is the Most Generous,

translations.english_hilali_khan: Who has taught (the writing) by the pen.

translations.english_saheeh: Taught man that which he knew not.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He has taught man that which he knew not.
translations.english_rwwad: taught man what he did not know.

translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! Verily, man does transgress (in disbelief and evil deed).

translations.english_rwwad: when he deems himself to be self-sufficient.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Surely, unto your Lord is the return.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen the one who forbids
translations.english_hilali_khan: Have you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) seen him (i.e. Abû Jahl) who prevents
translations.english_rwwad: Have you seen the one who prevents

translations.english_hilali_khan: A slave (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) when he prays?

translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen if he is upon guidance
translations.english_hilali_khan: Tell me if he (Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is on the guidance (of Allâh)
translations.english_rwwad: What if this [slave] is rightly guided,

translations.english_saheeh: Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Tell me if he (Abû Jahl) denies (the truth, i.e. this Qur’ân) and turns away?
translations.english_rwwad: How about the one who denies and turns away?

translations.english_saheeh: Does he not know that Allāh sees?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Knows he not that Allâh does see (what he does)?
translations.english_rwwad: Does he not know that Allah is watching all?

arabic_text: كـَلَّا لَئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
phonetic: 96.15 Kallā La'in Lam Yantahi Lanasfa`ā Bin-Nāşiyahi

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1952]- It may also mean "slap him" or "blacken his face at the forelock."

translations.english_saheeh: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[1952]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! If he (Abû Jahl) ceases not, We will catch him by the forelock -
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed; if he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock –

translations.english_saheeh: Then let him call his associates;
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then let him call upon his council (of helpers).
translations.english_rwwad: So let him call his associates;

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1953]- Those who push the wicked into the Fire.

translations.english_saheeh: We will call the angels of Hell.[1953]
translations.english_hilali_khan: We will call out the guards of Hell (to deal with him)!
translations.english_rwwad: We will call the wardens of Hellfire.

phonetic: 96.19 Kallā Lā Tuţi`hu Wa Asjud Wāqtarib

translations.english_saheeh: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay! (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم)! Do not obey him (Abû Jahl). Fall prostrate and draw near to Allâh!
translations.english_rwwad: No indeed; do not obey him, but prostrate and draw near [to Allah].
